A holiday was declared in Kamrup (Metro) for the cremation. The post-mortem will be conducted at GMCH by AIIMS doctors, with the cremation at Kamarkuchi NC Village.

title: US-India ties: Goyal, Jaishankar meet counterparts; no trade breakthrough
description: Amidst growing tensions, S. Jaishankar and Piyush Goyal engaged with their US counterparts in crucial meetings. Discussions encompassed contentious issues like Russian oil imports, Chabahar port sanctions, and H1B visa fees. Despite both nations affirming friendship, disagreements persist, particularly on trade imbalances and geopolitical strategies. While the US flags India's delaying tactics, India highlights the significant $212.

title: 'Captain jiska strike rate... ': Shahid Afridi blasts PCB over Salman Agha's appointment
description: Shahid Afridi has strongly criticised Pakistan cricket management's decision to appoint Salman Agha as T20I captain, citing Agha's low strike rate of 79. Afridi questioned how a captain with such a strike rate could inspire faster play.

title: Afghan teen hides in plane’s landing gear to reach Delhi; deported next day
description: A security incident occurred at Delhi Airport on Sunday when a 13-year-old Afghan boy was found after secretly boarding a Kam Air flight in Kabul by hiding in the landing gear. The boy, from Kunduz, was discovered wandering near the aircraft after it landed. Following questioning and procedures, he was sent back to Kabul on the same day.

description: Following US President Trump's decision to drastically increase H-1B visa fees from $10,000 to $100,000, tech giants are recalling their H-1B professionals. This move has reignited the debate around the H-1B program, which has been instrumental in the careers of tech leaders like Elon Musk, Satya Nadella, and Sundar Pichai.

title: H-1B visa hike: White House raises alarm; Says 40,000 US tech jobs lost to foreigners
description: President Trump introduced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visa applications, citing program abuse and American job losses. The White House claims companies are replacing American tech workers with lower-paid foreign labor, impacting national security. Trump aims to protect American workers by increasing costs for companies utilizing the H-1B program and prioritizing American-born workers in employment gains.
